result.reason: Screen.Bounds returns logical pixels and fullscreen DesktopWidth/DesktopHeight must be multiplied by per-monitor DPI scale factor to match the physical screen resolution.
result.approach: Ensure ResolutionScalingFactor uses the correct DPI source (InterfaceControl ?? _frmMain) and that both fullscreen code paths (Force.Fullscreen branch and RDPResolutions.Fullscreen case) consistently apply the scaling factor when setting DesktopWidth/DesktopHeight.

attempts.raw_output:
Based on the codebase analysis, the fullscreen resolution code in `RdpProtocol.cs` uses `screen.Bounds.Width/Height * ResolutionScalingFactor`. The bug in issue #1023 is that `Screen.Bounds` returns logical pixels (baseline 96 DPI), and if the `ResolutionScalingFactor` is not properly applied (or the DPI source control is null), the desktop dimensions sent to the RDP client will be understated â€” matching the logical/scaled-down size rather than the physical pixel resolution.
